title: Expectation propagation in linear regression models
venue: Heriot-Watt University, School of Engineering and Physical Sciences
description: Learn the basics of variational methods, including VB (MFVB and FFVB) and EP (parallel EP, AEP, SEP and α-EP) methods. Compare different variational methods in linear regression model. Explore the algorithm design with different problem-specific convariance constraints.

title: Modeling soccer scores by integrated nested Laplace approximation
venue: University of Edinburgh, School of Mathematics
description: Explore the basic ideas of INLA, and implement several models of increasing complexity for predicting the outcomes of soccer matches.

title: Review of “New error bounds for deep ReLU networks using sparse grids”
venue: University of Edinburgh, School of Mathematics
description: This is a paper aims to address the problem, why and when deep networks can lessen or break the curse of dimensionality. Instead of focusing on a particular set of functions which have a very special structure, they consider functions in the Korobov spaces which is more general for high dimensional multivariate approximation.

title: Regression models in JAGS
venue: University of Edinburgh, School of Mathematics
description: Compare three Bayesian models by implementing the models in JAGS, having JAGS sample from the corresponding posterior densities, and then using the deviance information criterion, DIC, for model comparison.

title: Individual seminar report: Off-the-grid sparse regularization
venue: University of Edinburgh, School of Mathematics
description: Get an overview on Clarice Poon’s seminar on Off-the-grid sparse estimation, which focuses on the theoretical analysis of the stability of the Beurling-Lasso method.

title: Bernstein type problem for minimal hypersurfaces
venue: Beihang University, School of Mathematical Science
description: Introduce the value distribution problem of Gauss map of minimal surfaces in Euclidean space and present major contributions by Osserman,Xavier and Fujimoto.

title: Rational solutions to an extended KP-like equation with symbolic computation
venue: Beihang University, School of Mathematical Science
description: An introduction to the Hirota bilinear method. Propose an extended KP-like equation with the generalized bilinear operators and discuss rational solutions based on polynomial solutions to the generalized bilinear equation.

title: Pagerank on the high-speed rail network in China
venue: Beihang University, School of Mathematical Science
description: Analyze the high-speed rail network using PageRank algorithm and graph theory methods.
